p.s: The novel Gun Love was published in the year 2019 and war written by Jennifer Clement.
The novel deals with the life of a girl named Pearl, who lives together with her mother in a trailer park in Florida.
In my following analyse I'm going to sum Helen, a character in the novel Gun Love, up.
Helen is a girl and a character in the novel Gun Love.
Helen is eight, but she looked about five (cf. l. 2).
Helen is even smaller than Pearl and Pearl is a very small kid (cf. l. 1).
Helen has a mother from Ethiopia and a mother from Finland (cf. ll. 6-8).
Because of the black mother from Ethiopia it can be said that she is dark skinned.
Of course she has a lot of relationships to other people.
Her friends are Lulu, Gina and Romey (cf. ll. 32-33).
She has also a relationship to Pearl and a relationship to a guy named Leo.
She doesn't know her identity, so who she is and where she came from.
Helen is a foster child and because of this and because of that she doesn't have an identity, it can be said, her relationship to her parents doesn't exist.
She often smiled and smelled like burned marshmallows (cf. l. 3).
Her smiling could say that she is a person with lot of fun and happiness because if a person is because of this conditions very sad they doesn't smile, they are often quiet.
Helen hasn't been brought up good because for example she often speaks in the third person and nobody corrected her (cf. l. 17).
Pearl said: Nobody had taught her how to pull her baby teeth out with strings (ll. 12-13), which shows also that she hasn't been brought up good.
Helen is also shameless because she said to Pearl that she smelled like insect repellent (cf. l. 42).
This shows maybe also that she hasn't been brought up good.
Helen talks without a break (cf. l. 5).
Her relationship to Pearl and Leo is good.
She likes Pearl and feels well in her near.
Pearl said: Helen crawled over to where I was sitting on the floor and sat very close to me.She rubbed her forehead against my upper arm (ll. 41-42).
This shows a kind of love to Pearl.
Her relationship to Leo is also good.
Leo said: Show Pearl your collection of telephones (l. 24).
Because of this sentence it can be said that Helen trust Leo because Leo already knows about her collection of telephones and the collection is private stuff.
Helen had a twin brother and sister and she had two twin sisters (cf. l. 9).
She has also a collection of phones because every foster home she goes to, they give her a phone and tell her to keep in touch (cf. l. 27).
She also likes cats and speaks about things like that with her friends (cf. ll. 33-35).
All in all is Helen a true-blue foster child with no real identity.
She hasn't been brought up good too but it can be said that because of the livelife as a foster child and the livelife of no real identity, she has many friends and is happy and not sad.
